item.title: Su add a quote by Anthony McGowan
item.description: "Thinking? You're not thinking. You're reasoning without reasons, and that's just another word for prejudice." -- Anthony McGowan

item.title: Su add a quote by Ambrose Bierce
item.description: "Prejudice is a vagrant opinion without visible means of support." -- Ambrose Bierce

item.title: Su add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Humor is reason gone mad." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Su add a quote by Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni
item.description: "Do not believe in anything simply because you have heard it. Do not believe in anything simply because it is spoken and rumored by many. Do not believe in anything simply because it is found written in your religious books. Do not believe in anything merely on the authority of your teachers and elders. Do not believe in traditions because they have been handed down for many generations. But after observation and analysis, when you find that anything agrees with reason and is conducive to the good and benefit of one and all, then accept it and live up to it." -- Buddha Siddhartha Guatama Shakyamuni

item.title: Su add a quote by John Kenneth Galbraith
item.description: "The complaints of the privileged are too often confused with the voice of the masses." -- John Kenneth Galbraith

item.title: Su add a quote by Yann Martel
item.description: "I must say a word about fear. It is life's only true opponent. Only fear can defeat life. It is a clever, treacherous adversary, how well I know. It has no decency, respects no law or convention, shows no mercy. It goes for your weakest spot, which it finds with unnerving ease. It begins in your mind, always ... so you must fight hard to express it. You must fight hard to shine the light of words upon it. Because if you don't, if your fear becomes a wordless darkness that you avoid, perhaps even manage to forget, you open yourself to further attacks of fear because you never truly fought the opponent who defeated you." -- Yann Martel

item.title: Su add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "I have a passion for teaching kids to become readers, to become comfortable with a book, not daunted. Books shouldn't be daunting, they should be funny, exciting and wonderful; and learning to be a reader gives a terrific advantage." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Su add a quote by Roald Dahl
item.description: "A person who has good thoughts cannot ever be ugly. You can have a wonky nose and a crooked mouth and a double chin and stick-out teeth, but if you have good thoughts they will shine out of your face like sunbeams and you will always look lovely." -- Roald Dahl

item.title: Su add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Su add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Poetry is what gets lost in translation." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Su add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "What greater gift than the love of a cat." -- Charles Dickens
